app-intro: Review plant 3D phenotyping experiments by matching all data from initial acquisitions to downstream analysis.
tooltip-scanlist-filter-data-availabilit: Filter results according to what data is available
tooltip-filter-scanlist-measures-availab: For phyllotaxis, Filter results according to what measures are available
tooltip-mesh-color-picker: Change the color of the mesh
tooltip-point-cloud-color-picker: Change the color of the point cloud
tooltip-segmentedpointcloud-color-picker: Change the colors of the segmented point cloud
tooltip-skeleton-color-picker: Change the color of the skeleton
tooltip-snapshot: Capture an image of the current view
tooltip-photoset: Change the set of displayed images in the carousel
tooltip-ruler: Make interactive measures on the plant
tooltip-scale-button: Setup measurements by specifying a distance equal to the scale above
tooltip-measure-button: Make a measure on the model
tooltip-scale-needed: You must define a scale before measuring
tooltip-help-rotate: Click left and hold to rotate
tooltip-help-pan: Click right and hold to pan
tooltip-download-sequence: Download the sequences in CSV/TSV format
angles-tooltip: Divergence angles are the angular differences between two consecutive organs. In the graph below, the angles are presented from bottom to top, starting with the angle between organs 1 and 2. The ideal angle is represented by the dotted line and corresponds to the golden angle of 137.5°.
internodes-tooltip: Internode distances are distances between two consecutive organs, in millimeters. In the graph below, they are presented from bottom to top, starting with the distance between organs 1 and 2.
